text: Python - Is a dictionary slow to find frequency of each character?
I am trying to find a frequency of each symbol in any given text using an algorithm of O(n) complexity.

code:
s = len(text) 
P = 1.0/s 
freqs = {} 
for char in text: 
    try: 
       freqs[char]+=P 
    except: 
       freqs[char]=P

text: but I doubt that this dictionary-method is fast enough, because it depends on the underlying implementation of the dictionary methods.
UPDATE: there is no increase in speed if collections and integers are used.
It is because the algorithm is already of O(n) complexity, so no essential speedup is possible.

code:
without collections:
real    0m0.695s

with collections:
real    0m0.625s
